Key Arguments: The legislation poses a threat to free speech in Australia.
Allowing ACMA to determine misinformation and disinformation is akin to authoritarian control.
Free speech is a fundamental aspect of democratic countries, distinguishing them from dictatorships.
Australia already has less protection of free speech compared to other Western countries.
The legislation would align Australia with communist countries in terms of speech control.
Notable Quotes: A law which proposes to allow one government body aka ACMA to be the arbiter of what constitutes misinformation and disinformation poses a complete threat to free speech in Australia.
Former High Court Judge Michael Kirby once said 'Australia has less protection of free speech than most Western countries'.
If this bill is passed into law, it puts Australia in a similar league to communist countries of the world.
